result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Christopher J Howard was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher J Howard is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Christopher J Howard was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Christopher J Howard was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Christopher J Howard was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

cover letter from DOC

Defendant Christopher J Howard in court with attorney Timothy S. Gebert.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gebert states that he has calculated the sentence credit totals 549 days and requests that defendant's probation be terminated.  Jennifer Spath states that the jail credit days were provided by the defendant.  Court is requesting confirmation regarding the jail credit days.  Court takes an adjournment to give the parties time to calculate the credit days.
Probation review hearing on May 20, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

ONLY EXHIBIT: from 03/13/04 Preliminary Hrg
13 EXHIBITS MARKED
Defendant's Proposed
cover letter from Attorney Schmidt w/Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions
Counts 1, 2 and 3.
from Jury
Counts 4 and 5 only

Defendant Christopher J Howard in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:50 a.m. On the record without the jury present.  Defendant enters pleas of no contest to Counts 4 and 5 of Case No. 14CF74.  Parties place stipulations on the record.  Court questions the parties regarding criminal convictions of the defendant. Attorney Lambert requests that a potential witness in this case not be identified by her real name.  Court will not allow.   

9:10 a.m.  Jury is brought in and Court is open.  
9:16 a.m.  20 jurors are called to the box.  Judge addresses the jury.  
9:17 a.m.  Atty. Lambert introduces himself and witnesses to the jury
9:18 a.m.  Atty. Schmidt introduces himself and defendant to the jury
9:19 a.m  Court commences with Voir Dire.  
9:26 a.m  Atty. Lambert commences with Voir Dire.  
9:46 a.m.  Atty. Schmidt commences with Voir Dire.
9:50 a.m.  Counsel commence strikes and Court instructs jury.
10:00 a.m. 12 jurors are sworn in and seated.  
10:02 a.m.  Atty. Lambert commences with opening statements.
10:07 a.m.  Atty. Schmidt addresses the jury with opening statements
10:12 Court recesses for 15 minutes. 

10:35 a.m. Court reconvenes with the jury present.  Nicole Williams is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to the incident in November, 2013 and testifies to her injuries.  Court takes judicial notice of the Injunction entered in this case.  Exhibit 1 is marked and received.  Testifies to the incident which took place in a vehicle.  Exhibit 4 is marked and reviewed by the witness.  Exhibit 4 is received.  Exhibit 5 is reviewed by the witness.  Exhibit 5 is received.  Witness reviews Exhibits 6, 7 and 8, which are received.  Photos are published to the jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Schmidt.  Questions witness at length regarding the specifics of the incidents in question.  11:16 a.m. Sidebar.  11:18 a.m.  Attorney Schmidt continues his cross-examination of the witness.  11:25 a.m. Sidebar.  11:26 a.m.  Re-direct by Attorney Lambert.  Exhibits 10 through 13 are marked and reviewed by the witness.  Exhibits 10 through 13 are received.  Re-direct by Attorney Lambert. Re-cross by Attorney Schmidt.  

11:38 a.m.  Rochelle Kehl is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to her relationship with Nicole.  Testifies to how she knows the defendant.  Witness reviews Exhibit 9.  Cross-examination by Attorney Karl.  

11:43 a.m.  Detective Nate Reblin is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to speaking with the Nicole regarding this incident.  Cross-examination by Attorney Schmidt.

11:47 a.m.  Officer Jordan Jadzdewski is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to speaking with Nicole regarding the January incident.  Cross-examination by Attorney Schmidt.  

11:53 a.m. State rests.  Jury leaves.  Court places the sidebar issues on the record.  11:56 a.m.  Court adjourns for lunch. 

1:03 p.m.  On the record without the jury present.  Court and counsel review jury instructions and verdict.  Court conducts his colloquy with the defendant.  

1:18 p.m.  Jury returns.  Officer Jazdzewski is recalled to the witness stand and questioned by Attorney Schmidt.  Questions witness regarding telephone records.  1:22 p.m.  Defense rests.  Sidebar.  Court instructs the jury.  

1:39 p.m.  Attorney Lambert gives his closing argument.  1:52 p.m.  Attorney Schmidt gives his closing argument.  2:01 p.m. Attorney Lambert gives rebuttal argument.  2:05 p.m. Court gives final instruction to the jury.  

2:11 p.m.  Bailiffs are sworn and the jury leaves to deliberate.  Court places the sidebar issue on the record.  

2:54 p.m.  On the record without the jury present.  The jurors have sent a note requesting a picture.  Court will send back three photographs, Exhibits 6, 7 and 8.  

3:15 p.m.  Case No. 13CM885:  Jury finds defendant not guilty of disorderly conduct.  Case No.  14CF74:  Jury finds defendant not guilty of Count 1; not guilty of Count 2;  guilty of Count 3.  Court polls the jury.   3:21 p.m.  State moves for judgment on the verdict on Count 3 of Case No. 14CF74 and dismissal of all other counts.   Court proceeds to sentencing.
Defendant's Proposed
cover letter from Attorney Schmidt w/Proposed Jury Instructions

Attorney Karl A. Schmidt in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schmidt brings motions. Parties stipulate that the defendant may wear street clothes during the trial.  Parties discuss photographs to be admitted during the trial. Parties agree to cropping the photos.  Parties discuss the motion regarding prior convictions of both defendant and victim.  

Attorney Karl gives his argument regarding a special verdict.

Defendant Christopher J Howard in court with attorney Karl A Schmidt.  Defendant Christopher J Howard in custody.  Kelly A Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schmidt argues in favor of a bond modification.  Attorney Lehn argues in opposition for the reduction of bond.  

Court denies.

from Atty. Karl A. Schmidt, dated April 3, 2014, re Motion to Modify Bond.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 25, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery
from Atty. Karl A. Schmidt, dated March 14, 2014, re Demand for Discovery.

Defendant Christopher J Howard in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt.  Defendant Christopher J Howard in custody.  Craig Steven Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Jordan Jazdzewski is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to speaking with N.W. who explained to him contact she had with the defendant.  Testifies that N.W. stated that defendant grabbed her by the neck.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Officer Brad Burris is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to speaking with N.W. who indicated that defendant contacted her by telephone harassing her.  Testifies to threats of physical harm.  

Court takes judicial notice of Case Nos. 14CM96, 13CM885 and 14CM64. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.
No contact with N.W.
